DataElement.preferredName: Breast Magnetic Resonance Imaging Enhancement Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the extent of breast parenchymal enhancement that occurs during MRI imaging.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Magnetic Resonance Imaging Enhancement Extent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Approaches and techniques used to improve the result of an MRI._One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders._The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Breast Magnetic Resonance Imaging Image Enhancement
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders. :improvement of the quality of a picture or image by various techniques; may include improvements to the equipment producing the images.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
improvement of the quality of a picture or image by various techniques; may include improvements to the equipment producing the images.

Property.preferredDefinition: The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

Concepts.definition: The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.._The textual representation for how an entity is enhanced, either physically or electronically._Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not severe or strong; far from extreme; not serious enough to endanger life.

Concepts.definition: Gentle or temperate in nature or degree.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.: The smallest possible quantity.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..:The textual representation for how an entity is enhanced, either physically or electronically.:Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.
The textual representation for how an entity is enhanced, either physically or electronically.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated for BOLD Imaging data collection
